page.title: 07Housing
page.content: The old part of Wroughton is called the Pitchens.Most of the houses are pre-war and have thatched roofs.There are a lot of trees surrounding the houses.It is a very small and quiet place.There is a small stream which runs along the side of the path to the reservoir.There is an old fasioned turnstyle near the stream and people go there for afternoon walks to the waterfall. Bakers Road is also very old has and has a row of old houses called Bakers Row.The whole area is at the foot of the scarp slope which is the original site of the village and still retains much of it's old character.
